brief: A JSONArray is an ordered sequence of values

methods.name: getString()
methods.desc: Gets the String value associated with an index

methods.name: getInt()
methods.desc: Gets the int value associated with the specified index

methods.name: getFloat()
methods.desc: Gets the float value associated with the specified index

methods.name: getBoolean()
methods.desc: Gets the boolean value associated with the specified index

methods.name: getJSONArray()
methods.desc: Retrieves the JSONArray with the associated index value

methods.name: getJSONObject()
methods.desc: Retrieves the JSONObject with the associated index value

methods.name: toStringArray()
methods.desc: Returns the entire JSONArray as an array of Strings

methods.name: toIntArray()
methods.desc: Returns the entire JSONArray as an array of ints

methods.name: append()
methods.desc: Appends a value, increasing the array's length by one

methods.name: setString()
methods.desc: Inserts a new value into the JSONArray at the specified index position

methods.name: setInt()
methods.desc: Put an int value in the JSONArray

methods.name: setFloat()
methods.desc: Put a float value in the JSONArray

methods.name: setBoolean()
methods.desc: Inserts a new value into the JSONArray at the specified index position

methods.name: setJSONArray()
methods.desc: Sets the value of the JSONArray with the associated index value

methods.name: setJSONObject()
methods.desc: Sets the value of the JSONObject with the index value

methods.name: size()
methods.desc: Gets the total number of elements in a JSONArray

methods.name: isNull()
methods.desc: Determines if the value associated with the index is null

methods.name: remove()
methods.desc: Removes the element from a JSONArray in the specified index position

description: A JSONArray stores an array of JSON objects. JSONArrays can be generated from scratch, dynamically, or using data from an existing file. JSON can also be output and saved to disk, as in the example above.
name: JSONArray
